Tom Emerson wrote:

>What are the recommendations for running multiple instances? Currently
>I keep n copies of the entire distro around, and invoke each one with
>a customized start script that sets the appropriate port and
>authentication credentials.
>
>  
>
>Looking at the code, it looks like I could have a single installation
>and multiple properties files, which specify by setting
>heritrix.properties on the command-line. So I have one copy of
>Heritrix that I start with different ports and different credentials.
>
>  
>
We've not played with running mutliple crawls concurrently within the 
one JVM instance. Hardest thing would be making the UI work with other 
than one job at a time.  If UI wasn't needed, there'd be some wrestling 
initially to make sure each crawl had its own config. and didn't share 
resources, but thereafter, it shouldn't be hard to get it going.

There's been little call for such a runtime configuration.  Do people 
think it important?

>And this raises another question, actually:
>
>Would it be possible, or is it already, to specify the port and
>login/password in the properties file?
>  
>
I'll add this to HEAD later today.

St.Ack
